intro: Physematium canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf dodder, is a parasitic flowering plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on host plants for nutrients. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers and has a complex life cycle involving both seed and vegetative propagation. The plant is characterized by its pale, often silvery appearance due to the presence of a waxy coating on its stems and leaves. It is native to various regions in Africa and is often found growing on grasses and other low-growing vegetation. Due to its parasitic nature, it can negatively impact the growth and health of its host plants.
